title: Would a thirsty person submerged up to its neck in water survive longer than a thirsty person outside of the water? - Quora

response.answer_text: What temperature is the water? Too cold and the person dies of hypothermia. Too hot and they die of hyperthermia. If the temperature is in the right range it will take over the temperature regulation normally regulated by sweat, which may help you survive if the air temperature is high or low. Besides that, no.
